pros: Great staff and amazing health care benefit
cons: Need to work here for a long time until employer invests in 401k

pros: Fantastic team, responsive and supportive management.
cons: Minimal opportunity for career growth and development.

pros: The team is a strong group of people interested in playing in the great outdoors and providing the best care possible to their patients.
cons: The building is a modular building and cannot hold enough weight for higher end strengthening equipment.

pros: Decent pay for cost of living. Wonderful staff members.

review_title: Would pick as a last resort
pros: Great co-workers, small community, great if you love doing outdoor activities
cons: Poor Leadership, consent changes, more managers than necessary

pros: Great hospital when I first started working there.  The work was usually enjoyable and I never felt overworked or patient safety was in question.
cons: New management. Nursing department is run by HR and administration, neither of which have a clue about the nurses doing the work and never visit to inquire about anything.  I was terminated for an alleged violation of email policy, which is NOT a terminable offense. I was under close scrutiny since my interview and knew it for the length of my 7.5 year employment there. I did not like being held to a higher standard than any of my female counterparts.

pros: Great staff, new facility, great location (for rural).
cons: Certain executive staff members have little real world experience and/or management practice knowledge.  Executive Management can be punitive, unnecessarily harsh, and just plain mean. The blind are leading the blind at NIH.

pros: positive attitude, concern for employee, very educated and understanding Coding Coordinator. education for employees great benefits wonderful pay
cons: I really can't think of any

pros: Highest pay scale close to skiing and hiking around lakes
cons: Small Town living , no shopping, hours away from anything.
